intro: Nonea atra, commonly known as black nonea, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Nonea atra is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
